en: The question is which to choose.
The problem was where to set up the tent.
The problem was where to eat lunch.
The question is where to buy the book.
The question is how we will bell the cat.
ko: 문제는 어떻게 고양이 목에 방울을 다느냐야.

en: The question is how will we deal with this difficult situation.
ko: 문제는 이 어려운 상황을 어떻게 대처하느냐야.

en: The problem is who is going to tell him the truth.
The point is that mother is not very hard on the child.
ko: 중요한 건 엄마가 애를 별로 엄하게 대하지 않는다는 거야.

en: The question is this: who called her on the phone?
ko: 문제는 이거야. 누가 걔한테 전화했느냐는 거지.

en: The question is this.
The trouble is that we have no money.
The question is when to start.
The problem is how to raise the funds.
The problem is how we cope with the present difficulties.
The problem is that solar energy costs too much.
ko: 문제는 태양 에너지가 비용이 너무 많이 든다는 거야.

en: The question is how to say no without making them angry.
ko: 문제는 기분 안 나쁘게 거절하는 법이야.

en: The question is how we can raise the money.
The question is not so much what it is as how it looks.
ko: 중요한 건 그게 뭐냐보다는 어떻게 보이느냐야.

en: The problem lies in the fact that the necessary gap is bridged by perception.
ko: 문제는 필요한 간극이 인식에 의해 채워진다는 데 있어.

en: The question is how to avoid nuclear war.
Some test questions are unfair to gorillas.
The person in question is now staying in America.
ko: 해당 인물은 지금 미국에 머물고 있어.

en: The root of the problem is a lack of communication between departments.
ko: 문제의 핵심은 부서 간의 소통 부족이야.

en: Sleeping on a problem solves it as easily as pouring oil on troubled waters.
ko: 한숨 자고 나면 문제는 아주 쉽게 해결돼.

en: The point at issue is not her ability but her character.
ko: 쟁점은 그 여자의 능력이 아니라 인성이야.

en: The question is whether he will come on time.
It is not what you read but how you read that matters.
ko: 중요한 건 뭘 읽느냐가 아니라 어떻게 읽느냐야.

en: The problem is Mr. Bark, the man whose secretary is away.
ko: 문제는 비서가 자리를 비운 바크 씨야.

en: No problem!
No prob.
No problem.
It is not her ability, but her character that is at issue.
ko: 문제가 되는 건 그 여자의 능력이 아니라 성격이야.

en: With regard to the matter in question, I will write to you in detail later.
ko: 해당 건에 대해서는 나중에 자세히 써서 보낼게.

en: The determining factor in question is whether this social welfare plan can facilitate the influx of immigrants.
ko: 결정적인 요인은 이 사회 복지 계획이 이민자 유입을 도울 수 있는지야.

en: It's not his ability, but his character that is at issue.
ko: 문제가 되는 건 걔 실력이 아니라 인성이야.

en: Is something wrong?
What's the matter?
It's a problem.
That's a problem.
Upon inquiring, I learned that she was out.
ko: 문의해 보니 그 여자는 외출 중이더라고.

en: I will have him call you the moment he gets back.
I'll return to get my handbag.
When I got back, my bag had disappeared without a trace.
ko: 돌아와 보니까 내 가방이 흔적도 없이 사라졌어.

en: I'll look it over after I come back.
He said on his return, "It has been a wonderful tour."
A specialist has his own strength.
Every man to his trade.
ko: 사람마다 전문 분야가 따로 있는 법이야.

en: We took it for granted that she would take part in the speech contest.
Don't give yourself airs.
I'd like to buy eye drops.
ko: 걔는 목표가 있다는 점에서 다른 애들이랑 달라.

en: She differs from the others in that she has a goal.
We played catch to achieve the goal.
I found it difficult to achieve my purpose.
It looked tough to achieve his aim.
ko: 결과가 수단을 항상 정당화하는 건 아니야.

en: The end does not necessarily justify the means.
Does the end justify the means?
ko: 목표가 옳다고 해도, 계획을 어떻게 실행할 건데?

en: Granting that the aim is right, how will you carry out the plan?
ko: 목적이 수단을 항상 정당화해 주는 건 아니야.

en: The end does not always justify the means.
ko: 황금알을 낳는 거위의 배를 가르는 격이지.

en: Kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
ko: 다가오는 시험 때문에 걔 마음이 아주 무거웠어.

en: The impending examination loomed large in her mind.
You must not think about your immediate profit only.
You must be polite to your elders.
I awoke to find myself in a strange room.
She woke to find herself in the hospital.
Adjust the setting of the alarm clock.
The alarm woke up Mayuko.
